easy.q: I have a tail but no body. I am not a animal, I am a line on a map. What am I?
easy.a: A sail? Noâ€”a boundary line? Hmm. The riddle is tricky; let's try: "A tail without a body is a kite's string". But keep it simple: 'A comical tail of a coin: edge? A riddle about the word 'tail' on a kite string'
easy.hint: Think of something that has a tail but not a real body.

medium.q: I am a word of letters three; add two, and fewer there will be.
medium.a: Few? The word 'few' has three letters; if you add two letters to form 'fewer' there are fewer items.

hard.q: A room has 3 lamps: red, green, and blue. Each lamp takes turns: red shines when the door is closed; blue shines when open. If you can only open the door once, which lamp lights at that moment and why?
hard.a: Blue lamp lights when the door is opened; the clue ties color to state of the door.
hard.hint: Think about cause and effect and state changes.
